author: ghudson
msg: Update the FSFS internal documentation to match reality.
* libsvn_fs_fs/README: Remove; all the work is done.
* structure: Update to reflect the way the back-end was actually
implemented.

author: jpieper
msg: Perform some cleanups to r9868 at the suggestion of Philip Martin.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.h
(svn_wc__logfile_path): New, determines the name to use for a given
numbered log file.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c
(svn_wc__logfile_path): New, implemented.
(svn_wc__run_log): Fix a possible error leak if svn_xml_parse
returned an error when an EOF was read.  Also, use
svn_wc__logfile_path where appropriate.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(cleanup_dir_baton): Simplify the error handling logic.
(do_entry_deletion, close_directory): Use the new factorized
svn_wc__logfile_path where appropriate.
(install_file): Use svn_wc__logfile_path and also initialize
merge_outcome.

author: ghudson
msg: In FSFS, turn the DAG node cache into an LRU cache.  Finally achieves
true O(n) FS performance for big imports and checkouts, because we no
longer expire a parent directory entry for every 32 child entries.
* libsvn_fs_fs/tree.c
(struct dag_node_cache_t): Add a path field, and replace idx field
with prev and next pointers for LRU list.  Also, add a typedef for
consistency.
(fs_root_data_t): Replace the node_cache_keys and node_cache_idx
fields with a dummy entry for the circular LRU list of cache
entries.
(dag_node_cache_get): When we get a cache hit, move the cache entry
to the head of the LRU list.
(dag_node_cache_set): Rewrite in terms of LRU list.
(dag_node_cache_invalidate): Iterate over LRU list instead of keys
array.
(make_root): Initialize the dummy entry of the LRU list.

author: jpieper
msg: Improve the performance of the libsvn_wc update editor by letting it
run multiple log files at the same time.  When running a group of log
files, the resulting entries file is written out only once at the
end.  Previously, the entries file was read and written at the
beginning and end of every log file.
As a result of this change, all logs in the working copy directory
have a numerical suffix that indicates which number they are in a
sequence.  During cleanup, the log files are executed in order, but
they are deleted in reverse order so that stale log files cannot be
left behind.
Many of the ideas necessary to make this work are from Philip Martin
<philip@codematters.co.uk>.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c
(svn_wc__run_log): Loop through all files named "log", "log.1",
"log.2", etc. until a non-existant file is found.  After executing
this log file group, erase them in reverse order.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(struct dir_baton): Add new log_number field to keep track of the
next available log file number for this directory.
(cleanup_dir_baton, cleanup_dir_baton_child): New, called when a
dir_baton is destroyed.  They run any left over log files so that
updates are easily resumable if a soft-interrupt caused the editor
to end.
(make_dir_baton): Initialize the new log file number field.
(struct file_baton): Add a field to record the directory that this
file is located in.
(make_file_baton): Initialize the dir_baton field.
(do_entry_deletion): Take new log_number parameter that accepts a
pointer to an integer that contains the next log file number to
use.  Reset this log number after running the log file group.
(delete_entry): Pass the log file number to do_entry_deletion.
(close_directory): Always run the current log file group.
(install_file): Take new log_number parameter, use it, and perform a
merge dry run if necessary so that the correct conflict status can
be reported to the caller.  Previously, running the log file would
generate this information.
(close_edit): Pass a log number of 0 to do_entry_deletion.
(svn_wc_add_repos_file): Pass a log number of 0 to install file and
run the resulting log file.

author: lundblad
msg: Replace printf, fprintf and fputs with svn_cmdline variants in svnversion
and svndumpfitler. Some _() markers added on strings.
This is a part of the fix for issue #780.
* svndumpfilter/main.c (close_revision, do_filter):
Replace printf, fprintf, fputs with svn_cmdline_ variants.
(main): Dito. Also flush stdout before normal exit.
* svnversion/main.c (usage): Replace fprintf with svn_cmdline_fprintf.
(main): Dito. Also flush stdout before normal exit.
